author: Sara Dober

review: It works the majority of the time when casting from my Moto X 1st gen. Sometimes the apps timeout and stop working and I'm taken to the Chromecast back drop screen but hey, it's only $35.00. No Google account is needed to use this device which is good because occasionally my friends stream content from their iPhones. I must say though that one major problem that I have always had with the Chromecast is that every time I try to cast my Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 's screen through the Chromecast app my device freezes and automatically reboots. There's not much else that needs to be said about this small TV dongle that hasn't already been said. You plug it into your HD television HDMI port, connect to your home's Wi-Fi network, and TADA! Your stale, old "dumb" TV suddenly becomes this magical device that lets you stream YouTube, Google Play content, and other marvelous web goodies with ease, a solid purchase in my opinion. :-)
author: Jovany Arredondo

review: Chrome cast is the way to go..small does not take up room and you can basically cast just about any show...Instead of paying the satellite or cable companies a monthly DVR fee, you can just cast the show from your phone anytime you want...We pay for basic satellite service for our hdtv and  then cast the shows from our phones to tv if we happen to miss it when broadcast.. Save a lot of $$$
